means: 困难的
硬的
有力的
努力的
努力地
猛力地
严重地
沉重地
英〉硬海滩，登陆处
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 哈德来源于古英语人名+日耳曼语，含义是“勇敢的，坚强的”(hardy,brave,strong)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 哈德绰号，严厉的人，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“严格的，坚定的”(hard,inflexible)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 哈德地貌名称，坚硬的土地
[地名] [奥地利] 哈尔德
high angular resolution diffusion 高角分辨率扩散
high area reduction die 面积高比率缩小芯片
high-aspect ratio drilling 高纵横比钻孔（法）
Hardware Resources for Development 硬件开发资源

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词均有"困难"之意。
means: difficult比hard较为正式，侧重需要特别的能力、智力、判断力、技巧或勇气才能克服障碍。也可指深奥或抽象的难题。
hard ： 含义广，通俗用词，与easy相对，泛指任何难理解，不好处理或不易做的事。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都可表示"坚定的，结实的"之意。
means: firm ： 侧重指质地坚硬、不易切割或有弹性，一旦变形会很快恢复原形。
hard ： 侧重有抗拒压力或拉力的性质，但不一定有弹性。
solid ： 着重质地紧密、坚实和无间隙，含有在外部压力下仍可保持原有形状的意味。

sentence.Network_en: When life gets hard and you want to give up, remember that life is full of ups and downs, and without the downs, the ups would mean nothing.
sentence.Network_cn: 当生活很艰难，你想要放弃的时候，请记住，生活充满了起起落落，如果没有低谷，那站在高处也失去了意义。

sentence.Network_en: Talent, hard work and sheer tenacity are all crucial to career success.
sentence.Network_cn: 事业要成功，才能、勤奋和顽强的意志都至关重要。

sentence.Network_en: The federal government hiked the tax on hard liquor.
sentence.Network_cn: 联邦政府提高了烈性酒的税率。

lj.lj_ly: you're being too hard on her.

jx.jx_en_mean: be difficult for or unfair to

lj.lj_ly: I think the war must have been hard on her.
lj.lj_ls: 我想战争一定使她吃了不少苦。

jx.jx_en_mean: be likely to hurt or damage

lj.lj_ly: the monitor flickers, which is hard on the eyes.
lj.lj_ls: 显示器闪烁不定，这对眼睛有害。

lj.lj_ly: you'll be hard put to find a better compromise.
lj.lj_ls: 你很难找到比这更好的折衷办法。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)deliberately make a situation difficult for someone

lj.lj_ly: it would go hard with the poor.
it would go hard with the poor.
they were hard at it with brooms and mops.
lj.lj_ls: 他们忙着用扫帚和拖把打扫卫生。

lj.lj_ly: he lived hard by the cathedral.
she would be justified in feeling hard done by.
lj.lj_ls: 要是她觉得受到了虐待，这完全有道理。

lj.lj_ly: there are no hard feelings and we wish him well.
lj.lj_ls: 我们一点不怨恨，我们希望他好。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 难理解的，难懂的；缺少乐趣的

lj.lj_ly: the studying is at times hard going.

jx.jx_cn_mean: 受到严重影响，受到严重打击

lj.lj_ly: Trinidad had been hard hit by falling oil prices.
lj.lj_ls: 特立尼达受到石油价格下跌的严重打击。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)used to express sympathy or commiserations
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)[用于表示同情、怜悯、遗憾、可惜]真可惜；真遗憾

lj.lj_ly: if you don't like it then hard luck.
lj.lj_ls: 如果你不喜欢它，那真是可惜。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)a person or thing that is difficult to understand or influence

lj.lj_ly: hard on the heels of Wimbledon comes the Henley Regatta.
lj.lj_ls: 温布尔登网球赛之后紧跟着就是亨里赛舟会。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hard, heard, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch hard and German hart

encyclopedia.content: 概述 Rihanna与Jeezy所演唱的歌曲"Hard"收录于Rihanna专辑《Rated R》中。它在2009年11月10日作为专辑第二支单曲发行。歌词大意 Oh Yeah 哦，耶 They can say whatever, i’ma do whatever 不管他们说什么，我走自己的路 No pain is forever, yup, you know this 没有永远的痛苦，耶，你也知道 Tougher than a lion, aint no need in trying 比狮子还凶悍，没悬念 I live where the sky ends, yup, you know this 我就

entry.def: Something that is hard is very firm and stiff to touch and is not easily bent, cut, or broken.

example.ex: He shuffled his feet on the hard wooden floor...
example.tran: 他拖着脚在硬木地板上走动。

example.ex: Something cold and hard pressed into the back of his neck.
example.tran: 一个冰冷梆硬的东西顶在了他的脖梗儿上。

entry.def: Something that is hard is very difficult to do or deal with.

example.ex: It's hard to tell what effect this latest move will have...
example.tran: 很难说最近这次行动会有什么结果。

example.ex: She found it hard to accept some of the criticisms directed towards her and her work...
example.tran: 她发现某些针对自己和自己工作的批评意见很难接受。

entry.def: If you work hard doing something, you are very active or work intensely, with a lot of effort.

example.ex: I'll work hard. I don't want to let him down...
example.tran: 我会努力工作，我不想让他失望。

example.ex: Am I trying too hard?
example.tran: 我是不是努力过头了？

entry.def: Hard work involves a lot of activity and effort.

example.ex: Coping with three babies is very hard work...
example.tran: 照顾3个宝宝是非常累人的活儿。

example.ex: ...a hard day's work...
example.tran: 一天的辛苦工作

entry.def: If you look, listen, or think hard, you do it carefully and with a great deal of attention.

example.ex: He looked at me hard...
example.tran: 他使劲盯着我看。

example.ex: You had to listen hard to hear the old man breathe...
example.tran: 你要仔细听才能听见老人的呼吸声。

entry.def: If you strike or take hold of something hard, you strike or take hold of it with a lot of force.

example.ex: I kicked a dustbin very hard and broke my toe.
example.tran: 我狠狠地踢了一脚垃圾箱，结果脚趾骨折了。

entry.tran: 强烈地;猛烈的;长时间地
entry.def: You can use hard to indicate that something happens intensely and for a long time.

example.ex: I've never seen Terry laugh so hard...
example.tran: 我从未见过特里如此放声大笑。

example.ex: It was snowing hard by then.
example.tran: 当时雪下得很大。

entry.def: If a person or their expression is hard, they show no kindness or sympathy.

example.ex: His father was a hard man...
example.tran: 他的父亲是个冷酷无情的人。

example.ex: Kate realized that the previous hard look on Maggie's face had been a mask.
example.tran: 凯特意识到玛吉原先的那副冷酷表情其实是装出来的。

entry.tran: 苛刻的;严厉的;不友善的
entry.def: If you are hard on someone, you treat them severely or unkindly.

example.ex: Don't be so hard on him.
example.tran: 别对他太苛刻了。

entry.def: If you say that something is hard on a person or thing, you mean it affects them in a way that is likely to cause them damage or suffering.

example.ex: The grey light was hard on the eyes...
example.tran: 光线暗淡对眼睛不利。

example.ex: These last four years have been hard on them.
example.tran: 过去的这四年里他们吃了不少苦。

entry.tran: （生活、一段日子）艰难的，艰苦的
entry.def: If you have a hard life or a hard period of time, your life or that period is difficult and unpleasant for you.

example.ex: It had been a hard life for her...
example.tran: 对她而言，那是一段非常艰苦的生活。

example.ex: Those were hard times.
example.tran: 那些岁月是非常艰难的。

entry.def: A hard winter or a hard frost is a very cold one.

example.ex: ...a prolonged period of hard frost...
example.tran: 漫长的强霜冻期

example.ex: I am expecting a long, hard winter.
example.tran: 我估计冬天会漫长而寒冷。

entry.tran: （颜色）刺目的，晃眼的;（声音）刺耳的，难听的
entry.def: Hard colours or sounds are harsh or bright and unpleasant to see or hear.

example.ex: The sea was a hard blue.
example.tran: 大海呈一片耀眼的蓝色。

entry.def: Hard evidence or facts are definitely true and do not need to be questioned.

example.ex: He wanted more hard evidence...
example.tran: 他想要更多确凿的证据。

example.ex: There are probably fewer hard facts about the life of Henry Purcell than that of any other great composer since the Renaissance.
example.tran: 有关亨利·普赛尔生平的可靠资料可能比任何其他文艺复兴以来的伟大作曲家都要少。

entry.tran: （水质）硬的（指含钙化合物较多）
entry.def: Hard water contains a lot of calcium compounds that stop soap making bubbles and sometimes appear as a deposit in kettles and baths.
Hard drugs are very strong illegal drugs such as heroin or cocaine.
In phonetics, a hard sound is one such as 'c' or 'g' as pronounced in the words 'cat' or 'give', and not as in the words 'cinema' or 'general'.
If one thing is hard by another, it is very close to it.

example.ex: Paradise Street was a short, crowded street near the railway station and hard by the factory.
example.tran: 天堂街是火车站附近一条拥挤的小街道，离该工厂很近。

entry.tran: 受到不公平待遇的;委屈的
entry.def: If you feel hard done by, you feel that you have not been treated fairly.

example.ex: The hall porter was feeling hard done by at having to extend his shift.
example.tran: 酒店行李搬运工因为被迫延长当班时间而愤愤不平。

entry.def: If you say that something is hard going, you mean it is difficult and requires a lot of effort.

example.ex: The talks had been hard going at the start.
example.tran: 会谈从一开始就举步维艰。

entry.tran: 受到沉重打击的;受严重影响的
entry.def: To be hard hit by something means to be affected very severely by it.

example.ex: California's been particularly hard hit by the recession.
example.tran: 加利福尼亚受经济衰退的影响尤为严重。

entry.tran: 佯装不感兴趣;故意摆谱
entry.def: If someone plays hard to get, they pretend not to be interested in another person or in what someone is trying to persuade them to do.

example.ex: I wanted her and she was playing hard to get.
example.tran: 我想得到她，但她却故意装出不感兴趣的样子。

entry.tran: 十分困难的;处于困境的
entry.def: If someone is hard put to do something or, in British English if they are hard pushed to do something, they have great difficulty doing it.

example.ex: Mr Morton is undoubtedly cleverer than Mr Kirkby, but he will be hard put to match his popularity.
example.tran: 莫顿先生无疑比柯克比先生更聪明，但他将很难像柯克比先生那样受人欢迎。

entry.tran: 为…而非常苦恼（或难受）；因…而沮丧
entry.def: If you take something hard, you are very upset or depressed by it.

example.ex: Maybe I just took it too hard.
example.tran: 可能我真的对此事太过耿耿于怀。

means.word_mean: 1. not easy; requiring great physical or mental effort to accomplish or comprehend or endure;

sentences.sentence: "nesting places on the cliffs are difficult of access"
"why is it so hard for you to keep a secret?"

means.word_mean: 3. not yielding to pressure or easily penetrated;
5. characterized by toilsome effort to the point of exhaustion; especially physical effort;

sentences.sentence: "worked their arduous way up the mining valley"
"spent many laborious hours on the project"

means.word_mean: 7. of a drinker or drinking; indulging intemperately;

sentences.sentence: "hard dry rolls left over from the day before"

means.word_mean: 1. with effort or force or vigor;

sentences.sentence: "she was severely affected by the bank's failure"
"concrete that sets hard within a few hours"

means.word_mean: 8. very near or close in space or time;

sentences.sentence: "it stands hard by the railroad tracks"
"a strike followed hard upon the plant's opening"

means.word_mean: 9. with pain or distress or bitterness;
10. to the full extent possible; all the way;

example.en: Old Freddie is earning some hard coin these days.
example.zh: 老弗雷迪近来在赚大钱。

example.en: Fred worked as a hard-rocker and made a fortune.
example.zh: 弗雷德做过矿工并且发了一笔财。

list.explanation: [黑社会用语]钱(尤指不义之财)

example.en: I don't want any hard stuff. I've never tak-en a bribe from anyone.
example.zh: 我不要不义之财。我从没收过人家的贿赂。

example.en: The troubles the hard stuff inflicts on men with no defense against it.
example.zh: 烈性酒对人体所造成的无法抵挡的危害。

list.explanation: (总称)硬毒品(指易上瘾的烈性毒品)

auth_sentence.content: To get beat by your arch rivals is hard.
auth_sentence.res_content: To get beat by your arch rivals is hard.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To get beat by your arch rivals is hard.

auth_sentence.content: Then, the hard part begins - landing safely.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then, the hard part begins - landing safely.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then, the hard part begins - landing safely.

auth_sentence.content: It is hard to imagine a more likeable heroine.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is hard to imagine a more likeable heroine.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is hard to imagine a more likeable heroine.

stems_affixes.word_buile: hard硬,艰难+y……的→adj.强壮的,耐劳的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 硬的[地],坚固的[地]; 困难的[地]
stems_affixes.word_buile: hard硬,艰难→adj.&adv.硬的[地],坚固的[地]; 困难的[地]

stems_affixes.value_cn: 刚刚, 几乎不, 仅, 严厉的, 艰辛的
stems_affixes.word_buile: hard硬,艰难+ly……地→adv.刚刚, 几乎不, 仅, 严厉的, 艰辛的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 硬, 硬度, 艰难, 难度
stems_affixes.word_buile: hard硬,艰难+ness性质,状态→n.硬, 硬度, 艰难, 难度

stems_affixes.value_cn: 五金器具,金属制品;[计算机]硬件
stems_affixes.word_buile: hard硬,艰难+ware物件→硬件→五金器具,金属制品
hard硬,艰难+en表动词→v.使变硬 v.变硬

means.word_mean: 硬的, 坚实的, 坚固的

sentences.en: The stone is hard to the touch.
This candy is so hard that no one can chew it.
sentences.cn: 这种糖太硬, 没人嚼得动。

sentences.en: Is English a hard language to learn?
sentences.cn: 英语是一种难学的语言吗?

sentences.en: The book is so hard that I cannot read it at all.
sentences.cn: 这本书太难了, 我一点儿也读不懂。

sentences.en: He earned a bare living by his hard work.
sentences.cn: 他辛辛苦苦地工作仅够糊口。

means.word_mean: 铁石心肠的, 冷酷无情的, 严厉的

sentences.en: Good sports records come from hard training.
sentences.cn: 良好的运动成绩是靠严格训练取得的。

sentences.en: The young man worked very hard and soon began to get ahead.
sentences.cn: 那个年轻人很勤奋, 他的事业很快有了进展。

jushi.english: The jar contained assorted hard candies.
jushi.chinese: 这罐子里装有什锦硬糖。

jushi.english: Can linguistics ever be a hard science like physics?
jushi.chinese: 语言学是否能成为像物理学那样实在的科学?

jushi.english: They have had a hard time bringing up ten children.
jushi.chinese: 他们把10个孩子拉扯大真不容易。
